Simulate data for testing

simulate_data.Rd

This function simulates a dataset with PGS, covariates, and dependent variables for testing purposes.

Usage

simulate_data(
  n = 10000,
  seed = NULL,
  n_pgs = 5,
  pgs_true_her_explained = 0.25,
  pgs_her_explained_ub = pgs_true_her_explained/2,
  pgs_her_explained_lb = pgs_true_her_explained/4,
  age_prop_explained = 0.25,
  env_prop_explained = 0.5,
  dep_prevalence = 0.25
)

Arguments

n

The number of observations to simulate. Default: 10000.

seed

The random seed for reproducibility. Default: NULL.

n_pgs

The number of PGS to simulate. Default: 5.

pgs_true_her_explained

Has to be >= 0 and <= 0.5. Default: 0.25.

pgs_her_explained_ub

Lower bound of heritability explained by PGS.

pgs_her_explained_lb

Upper bound of heritability explained by PGS.

age_prop_explained

The proportion of y and y_bin explained by age. Default: 0.25.

env_prop_explained

The proportion of y and y_bin explained by other environmental factors. Default: 0.5.

dep_prevalence

Prevalence of the binary trait. Default: 0.25.

Value

A data.table with simulated data

Examples

# Simulate data
data <- simulate_data(n = 1000, n_pgs = 3)
print(data)
